Package server

Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • server.Client
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Administrator, Guide, Moderator, Presenter
    public abstract class Client
extends java.lang.Object
    Class representing specific account within the system, of unspecified role Currently created only when client connects with the system and used only to construct a derived class of specified role (eg. Guide) once identified, should be changed into abstract class in the future

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      protected java.io.ObjectInputStream in
      Stream for receiving information from this specific client
      protected java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicBoolean inputThreadRunning
      Condition for input thread to work
      protected java.io.ObjectOutputStream out
      Stream for sending information to this specific client
      protected java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentLinkedQueue<NetworkMessage> outgoingMessages
      Messages enqueued for sending to client
      protected java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicBoolean outputThreadRunning
      Condition for output thread to work

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor Description
      protected Client​(java.io.ObjectOutputStream out, java.io.ObjectInputStream in)
      Creates basic client connection with provided streams

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean addOutgoingMessage​(NetworkMessage message)
      Adds message for sending to this client.
      static Client createSpecifiedClient​(java.io.ObjectOutputStream out, java.io.ObjectInputStream in)
      Creates proper subclass of Client depending on his assigned role within the system
      void dismiss()
      Closes client's communication threads (can be restarted later)
      protected abstract void handlingInput()
      Method responsible for receiving and filtering data received from the client.
      protected abstract void handlingOutput()
      Method responsible for handling sending outgoing data to the client through provided output stream.
      void removeFromSystem()
      Empty procedure to override in subclasses used for removing all references to given client from the system, mostly used when client disconnects
      protected void sendStartingData()
      Sends client initial event data, containing only information which doesn't change during the course of this event
      void stopInputThread()
      Stops client input thread
      void stopOutputThread()
      Stops client output thread

    • Method Detail

      • stopOutputThread

        public void stopOutputThread()
        Stops client output thread

      • stopInputThread

        public void stopInputThread()
        Stops client input thread

      • createSpecifiedClient

        public static Client createSpecifiedClient​(java.io.ObjectOutputStream out,
                                           java.io.ObjectInputStream in)
                                    throws java.net.SocketTimeoutException,
                                           java.io.EOFException
        Creates proper subclass of Client depending on his assigned role within the system
        Parameters:
        out - Output stream connected to client
        in - Input stream connected to client
        Returns:
        New client of proper type
        Throws:
        java.net.SocketTimeoutException - if client takes too long to respond
        java.io.EOFException - if client's socket has been closed

      • sendStartingData

        protected final void sendStartingData()
                               throws java.io.IOException
        Sends client initial event data, containing only information which doesn't change during the course of this event
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When socket is unable to send message

      • removeFromSystem

        public void removeFromSystem()
        Empty procedure to override in subclasses used for removing all references to given client from the system, mostly used when client disconnects

      • dismiss

        public void dismiss()
        Closes client's communication threads (can be restarted later)

      • handlingInput

        protected abstract void handlingInput()
                               throws java.net.SocketTimeoutException,
                                      java.io.EOFException
        Method responsible for receiving and filtering data received from the client.
        Throws:
        java.net.SocketTimeoutException - when client response time is longer than given maximum
        java.io.EOFException - when client socket has been closed

      • handlingOutput

        protected abstract void handlingOutput()
        Method responsible for handling sending outgoing data to the client through provided output stream.

      • addOutgoingMessage

        public boolean addOutgoingMessage​(NetworkMessage message)
        Adds message for sending to this client. Detailed description of message structure can be found in NetworkMessage.
        Parameters:
        message - Message to be sent
        Returns:
        True if message has been successfully enqueued for sending, false otherwise
